page.title: 11 WAINLODE
page.content: Wainlode is an isolated hamlet lying at the foot of Wainlode Hill on the east bank of the River Severn. There is just a public house called the Red Lion with a caravan site behind it and a couple of farms called Hill Farm and Green Farm.There are a few other cottages which appear to be used as holiday homes or weekend cottages for people fishing along the River Severn. The houses are just above normal flood level but even so the narrow road from Norton to Lower Apperley is often cut by floodwater in winter. The Red Lion public house has a flood marker on it showing exceptional flood levels. The hill to the south of the hamlet is covered in a mixture of coniferous and deciduous woodland.
